Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Engage in active listening
Elaboration: Actively watching and following what teachers and peers are doing and interacting appropriately by copying the actions of peers

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Engage in active listening
Elaboration: Using a variety of body language to respond to a speaker; for example, nodding, eye contact, posture (such as leaning forward), gestures and facial expressions

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Engage in active listening
Elaboration: Identifying key words and phrases that refer to known objects in the classroom or locations in the school

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Engage in active listening
Elaboration: Recognising simple rhymes, songs with actions or lists of words, for example for days of the week and colours of the rainbow

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Engage in active listening
Elaboration: Predicting the meaning of an unfamiliar word in a conversation, based on an understanding of the topic and other words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to simple questions and prompts
Elaboration: Recognising single pieces of information from short spoken texts, for example for a number, colour or name or a key word related to personal needs (such as ‘drink’ or ‘bathroom’)

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to simple questions and prompts
Elaboration: Recognising and responding to less familiar action verbs in instructions when accompanied by contextual information, for example in ‘Line up, please.’ with the sound of the bell ringing for recess

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to simple questions and prompts
Elaboration: Listening to and reproducing the sequence of ideas in a short spoken story or recount

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in simple social or routine learning activities by relying on key words, paralinguistic (non-verbal) communication and context
Elaboration: Rehearsing formulas or short exchanges, based on models, for example ‘Hello, what is your name?’, ‘My name is … What is your name?’ and ‘Pleased to meet you.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in simple social or routine learning activities by relying on key words, paralinguistic (non-verbal) communication and context
Elaboration: Using social formulas, for example ‘please’, ‘thank you’ and ‘excuse me’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in simple social or routine learning activities by relying on key words, paralinguistic (non-verbal) communication and context
Elaboration: Using learnt phrases in different situations, for example ‘What’s the time?’, ‘Oh, no!’ and ‘Very good!’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in simple social or routine learning activities by relying on key words, paralinguistic (non-verbal) communication and context
Elaboration: Expressing opinions about an experience or text in simple ways, for example ‘I like.’ and ‘Not good.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in simple social or routine learning activities by relying on key words, paralinguistic (non-verbal) communication and context
Elaboration: Understanding common vocabulary related to personal and social needs (such as ‘toilet’, ‘pencil’ and ‘stop’) and constructing simple phrases with this vocabulary, for example ‘Go toilet?’, ‘This my pencil.’ and ‘Stop that!’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in simple social or routine learning activities by relying on key words, paralinguistic (non-verbal) communication and context
Elaboration: Using picture cards, classroom charts and objects to enhance communication; for example, pointing to a picture

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Follow a sequence of simple utterances, with teacher and contextual support
Elaboration: Understanding a simple spoken text when accompanied by visual support, for example for instructions for and demonstration of a game or art activity

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Follow a sequence of simple utterances, with teacher and contextual support
Elaboration: Demonstrating how to make or do something with some accompanying words and phrases

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Follow a sequence of simple utterances, with teacher and contextual support
Elaboration: Role-playing popular stories or songs such as Goldilocks and the Three Bears

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise familiar spoken texts
Elaboration: Identifying familiar spoken texts used frequently in class, such as songs, rhymes and stories

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise familiar spoken texts
Elaboration: Participating in shared oral reading of familiar texts; for example, joining in the chorus or saying a repeated line from a familiar text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use a small range of simple sentence patterns
Elaboration: Understanding common time references in basic sentences, for example in ‘We went yesterday.’, ‘We will go tomorrow.’ and ‘Now we can eat lunch.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use a small range of simple sentence patterns
Elaboration: Pointing to people or illustrations when responding to questions or instructions using gendered personal pronouns such as ‘him’ or ‘her’ or possessive pronouns such as ‘his’ or ‘her’, for example pointing and saying, ‘That is him.’ and ‘There is her bag.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use a small range of simple sentence patterns
Elaboration: Using gendered pronouns with accuracy some of the time, for example in ‘He is my dad.’ and ‘She is my aunty.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Construct simple subject–verb–object sentences
Elaboration: Matching simple verb tense to time words, for example in ‘Yesterday we did …’ and ‘Tomorrow we will do …’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Construct simple subject–verb–object sentences
Elaboration: Using ‘no’ or ‘not’ with adjectives or nouns to express negation, for example in ‘Not finished.’ and ‘Not cold today.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Demonstrate variable placement of common adjectives and adverbs to describe or add emphasis
Elaboration: Using a small range of common adjectives, for example in ‘the big house’ and ‘smelly socks’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Demonstrate variable placement of common adjectives and adverbs to describe or add emphasis
Elaboration: Combining some common adverbs with verbs to describe action, with varying degrees of accuracy, for example in ‘walk slowly’ and ‘sing good’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Demonstrate variable placement of common adjectives and adverbs to describe or add emphasis
Elaboration: Using common adverbs to vary the intensity of adjectives, for example in ‘very hot’ and ‘little bit funny’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use words related to immediate communicative needs, interests or experiences
Elaboration: Identifying key words and phrases that refer to familiar objects in the classroom, for example in ‘Please pass glue stick.’ and ‘Hang bag on hook.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use words related to immediate communicative needs, interests or experiences
Elaboration: Using a single word for a variety of purposes; for example, using ‘book’ to mean ‘This is my book.’, ‘Where is her book?’ or ‘I’d like to borrow that book.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use words related to immediate communicative needs, interests or experiences
Elaboration: Referring to classroom charts and a simple personal vocabulary list to identify, clarify and rehearse words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use words related to immediate communicative needs, interests or experiences
Elaboration: Using a variety of strategies to embed learnt words and phrases in their own speech and writing, for example as private rehearsal and a simple personal vocabulary list

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use comprehensible pronunciation to blend, segment and manipulate familiar words
Elaboration: Recognising and producing rhyming words when listening to rhyming stories or rhymes, for example ‘funny’ and ‘money’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use comprehensible pronunciation to blend, segment and manipulate familiar words
Elaboration: Identifying patterns of alliteration in known spoken words, for example ‘helpful Hasma’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use comprehensible pronunciation to blend, segment and manipulate familiar words
Elaboration: Saying a word when given the sounds, for example ‘lip’ for ‘l-i-p’ and ‘munch’ for ‘m-u-n-ch’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use comprehensible pronunciation to blend, segment and manipulate familiar words
Elaboration: Saying whether sounds are the same or different; for example, comparing the vowel sounds in ‘ship’ and ‘sheep’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use comprehensible pronunciation to blend, segment and manipulate familiar words
Elaboration: Saying an unfamiliar word when the beginning phoneme (the smallest unit of sound in a word), middle or end phoneme is replaced with a different phoneme; for example, ‘run’ becomes ‘fun’ and ‘fun’ becomes ‘fan’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use comprehensible pronunciation to blend, segment and manipulate familiar words
Elaboration: Identifying syllables in known spoken words, for example clapping the rhythm of ‘Mon-day’, ‘Ti-en’ or ‘A-si-ma’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise ways that sentence stress and intonation are used to enhance meaning or distinguish statements from questions
Elaboration: Recognising that a question has been asked, based on intonation

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise ways that sentence stress and intonation are used to enhance meaning or distinguish statements from questions
Elaboration: Recognising emotions such as happiness and anger expressed through intonation

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise ways that sentence stress and intonation are used to enhance meaning or distinguish statements from questions
Elaboration: Distinguishing between questions, instructions and statements based on clear intonation and contextual information, for example in the actions of peers

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise ways that sentence stress and intonation are used to enhance meaning or distinguish statements from questions
Elaboration: Using rising intonation for questions and stressing key words for emphasis

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise when to respond in English and when to respond in home language
Elaboration: Recognising when being spoken to in English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise when to respond in English and when to respond in home language
Elaboration: Assessing which language(s) a speaker knows, and responding appropriately

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise when to respond in English and when to respond in home language
Elaboration: Making connections between new English words and home language words containing similar sounds

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use simple strategies to clarify spoken communication and respond to misunderstandings
Elaboration: Requesting attention or assistance from the teacher or a peer by using intonation to signal a request, or indicating non-understanding through speech or body language

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use simple strategies to clarify spoken communication and respond to misunderstandings
Elaboration: Using simple formulaic expressions to ask for clarification, for example ‘Please say again.’ and ‘What is that?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use simple strategies to clarify spoken communication and respond to misunderstandings
Elaboration: Listening to and using a speaker’s key words when asking for clarification; for example, Teacher: ‘Paste it in your book.’ Student: ‘Language book?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on a range of home language resources to enhance learning when listening and speaking
Elaboration: Asking home language peers for help with translating personal needs and responses from a home language to English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on a range of home language resources to enhance learning when listening and speaking
Elaboration: Asking home language peers to explain an idea in a home language and asking for a translation in English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on a range of home language resources to enhance learning when listening and speaking
Elaboration: Asking for clarification from other home language speakers

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use a range of simple social formulas and gestures to interact with others orally
Elaboration: Recognising that words, gestures and intonations may be appropriate or inappropriate in certain contexts; for example, saying ‘please’ when asking for something from a peer

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use a range of simple social formulas and gestures to interact with others orally
Elaboration: Demonstrating that they are paying attention through paralinguistic (non-verbal) communication; for example, using body orientation, nodding, gesturing and facial expressions such as smiling and laughing

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use a range of simple social formulas and gestures to interact with others orally
Elaboration: Understanding when a response is required and attempting to respond appropriately to questions by using a variety of paralinguistic (non-verbal) communication and/or short responses

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use a range of simple social formulas and gestures to interact with others orally
Elaboration: Recalling and using common social formulas when interacting with others; for example, saying ‘sorry’, ‘please’, ‘thank you’ and ‘excuse me’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Understand the main themes or ideas of short, familiar print and digital texts, with teacher support
Elaboration: Scanning texts for familiar words and short phrases in context; for example, looking for the names of main characters or key topic vocabulary

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Understand the main themes or ideas of short, familiar print and digital texts, with teacher support
Elaboration: Understanding the main ideas of short texts about a topic studied in class and responding to questions; for example, naming characters from a story or identifying an animal illustration based on a description

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Understand the main themes or ideas of short, familiar print and digital texts, with teacher support
Elaboration: Demonstrating comprehension through appropriate activities; for example, retelling the main ideas from a text, sequencing pictures representing the main events in a story, or painting or drawing events, settings or characters in a text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify key information in simple, familiar texts, with teacher support
Elaboration: Recognising illustrations or character names when re-reading a familiar story

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify key information in simple, familiar texts, with teacher support
Elaboration: Identifying characters, settings or key events in a narrative

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify key information in simple, familiar texts, with teacher support
Elaboration: Identifying or recounting one or 2 facts from a non-fiction text, for example ‘Sharks have sharp teeth.’ and ‘Cars have 4 wheels.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Match images to familiar words and phrases, with teacher support
Elaboration: Explaining the meaning of everyday signs and labels such as a stop sign on a road and an exit sign near a door

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Match images to familiar words and phrases, with teacher support
Elaboration: Naming some familiar logos or symbols such as a common emoji

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Match images to familiar words and phrases, with teacher support
Elaboration: Identifying characters or objects that are represented in both images and print text; for example, noticing a familiar cartoon character

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Match images to familiar words and phrases, with teacher support
Elaboration: Matching a short description to an image, for example for ‘a green fruit’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Make simple predictions or inferences about a text, with teacher support
Elaboration: Making simple predictions about the topic or purpose of a text based on the introduction, for example about the purpose of an instructional video

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Make simple predictions or inferences about a text, with teacher support
Elaboration: Using images on a book cover or illustrations within the text to predict what might happen next

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Make simple predictions or inferences about a text, with teacher support
Elaboration: Finishing familiar phrases or sentences from known texts; for example, joining in a repeated chorus or refrain within a familiar text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the basic features of different types of texts
Elaboration: Recognising a small range of familiar text types such as recount, narrative, instructional report and information report

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the basic features of different types of texts
Elaboration: Answering simple questions about the features of a text, for example when asked ‘What is the name of this text?’ and ‘Where is there a list in this text?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the basic features of different types of texts
Elaboration: Matching labels to parts of a simple text, for example to the title, introduction, requirements and method of a procedure; the title, images and text on a poster; and the text, hyperlinks and images on a website

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the basic features of different types of texts
Elaboration: Following step-by-step instructions to find information in a print or digital text in response to a question, for example when asked ‘Open the book and turn to the contents page. Now find the heading that says “Ocean”. Which page should we turn to?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the basic features of different types of texts
Elaboration: Identifying and naming elements of book layout and aspects of reading such as word, letter, page, title and cover

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the basic features of different types of texts
Elaboration: Pointing to parts of a book in response to questions and instructions, for example when asked ‘What is the author’s name?’ and ‘Find the start of the sentence.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise a range of familiar words and phrases
Elaboration: Recognising personally significant words, for example when seeing their own name on charts, book labels and name tags

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise a range of familiar words and phrases
Elaboration: Locating and pointing to familiar words or phrases when prompted, for example when asked ‘This book is about frogs. Where can you see the word “frog”?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise a range of familiar words and phrases
Elaboration: Learning that words are made up of meaningful parts, for example that ‘dogs’ has 2 meaningful parts: ‘dog’ and ‘s’ (meaning ‘more than one’)

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise a range of familiar words and phrases
Elaboration: Recognising familiar high-frequency words such as ‘and’, ‘my’, ‘is’, ‘the’ and ‘go’ in shared and independent reading texts

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify some sounds in words, and some common letters and letter patterns in words
Elaboration: Recognising letters in recurring words, for example in the names of peers and teachers

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify some sounds in words, and some common letters and letter patterns in words
Elaboration: Matching upper-case and lower-case letters and identifying their sounds

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify some sounds in words, and some common letters and letter patterns in words
Elaboration: Relating some letters of the alphabet to their common sounds; for example, relating vowels to their short vowel sound

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify some sounds in words, and some common letters and letter patterns in words
Elaboration: Using initial letters and common letter patterns to decode unfamiliar words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify some sounds in words, and some common letters and letter patterns in words
Elaboration: Locating words containing the same letter patterns in a short text, for example in words containing ‘ch’ or all words with double letters

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify some sounds in words, and some common letters and letter patterns in words
Elaboration: Recognising that different ways of forming letters and different fonts do not change meaning

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Understand the function of capital letters, spaces and full stops
Elaboration: Pausing at full stops when reading aloud

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Understand the function of capital letters, spaces and full stops
Elaboration: Using spaces to identify and count words in a sentence or on a line

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Understand the function of capital letters, spaces and full stops
Elaboration: Recognising that capital letters and full stops can form sentence boundaries, and can be used to identify and count sentences

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish print and digital English texts from home language texts
Elaboration: Identifying a text written in English or pointing to English words in a multilingual text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish print and digital English texts from home language texts
Elaboration: Holding and navigating English books appropriately and confidently

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish print and digital English texts from home language texts
Elaboration: Identifying the intended audience of English and home language texts, for example in ‘This story is for children.’ and ‘This book is for adults.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Select suitable texts for their own reading, with teacher and peer support
Elaboration: Selecting and engaging with books of personal interest during independent reading

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Select suitable texts for their own reading, with teacher and peer support
Elaboration: Exploring a new book before reading to determine interest, by looking at the images, amount of print and familiar elements

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Select suitable texts for their own reading, with teacher and peer support
Elaboration: Seeking books in a home language or related to familiar topics to share with family members

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Select suitable texts for their own reading, with teacher and peer support
Elaboration: Engaging with picture books selected by the teacher and some self-selected books

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on a range of home language resources to enhance learning when reading and viewing
Elaboration: Asking home language peers for help with translating personal needs and responses from a home language to English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on a range of home language resources to enhance learning when reading and viewing
Elaboration: Asking home language peers to explain an idea in a home language and asking for a translation in English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on a range of home language resources to enhance learning when reading and viewing
Elaboration: Referring to picture dictionaries or bilingual dictionaries in the classroom to check meaning

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on a range of home language resources to enhance learning when reading and viewing
Elaboration: Making simple multilingual mind maps or vocabulary charts of key words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared reading activities, including reading aloud, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Listening to a teacher or peer read text aloud, then rehearsing and imitating pronunciation, intonation and emphasis

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared reading activities, including reading aloud, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Reading aloud short, familiar texts such as simple rhymes, songs and repetitive texts

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared reading activities, including reading aloud, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Reading short texts aloud, with prompts from the teacher, for example for their own writing or a story or text used in class

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared reading activities, including reading aloud, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Answering simple questions about their personal experiences related to stories, for example when asked ‘Have you ever … ?’ and ‘Do you like … too?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared reading activities, including reading aloud, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Expressing a simple opinion on a text; for example, indicating like or dislike of a character

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared reading activities, including reading aloud, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Contributing to shared responses to texts; for example, sequencing images in order, matching sentence stems and endings, answering simple questions about ideas in a text and acting out events

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write familiar words, phrases or short texts and write simple functional texts related to their own experience or school context, with teacher support
Elaboration: Writing or typing familiar words such as their own name, without copying

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write familiar words, phrases or short texts and write simple functional texts related to their own experience or school context, with teacher support
Elaboration: Writing the names of items depicted in images or captions for images

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write familiar words, phrases or short texts and write simple functional texts related to their own experience or school context, with teacher support
Elaboration: Writing short formulaic sentences to describe images, for example ‘This is a …’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write familiar words, phrases or short texts and write simple functional texts related to their own experience or school context, with teacher support
Elaboration: Completing sentences giving personal information, for example ‘My name is …’ and ‘I have … people in my family.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write familiar words, phrases or short texts and write simple functional texts related to their own experience or school context, with teacher support
Elaboration: Recounting personal experiences in sequence

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write familiar words, phrases or short texts and write simple functional texts related to their own experience or school context, with teacher support
Elaboration: Writing a simple description, recount or procedure after a shared class experience, for example as a short text recounting how to make toast

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write familiar words, phrases or short texts and write simple functional texts related to their own experience or school context, with teacher support
Elaboration: Writing a simple response to a familiar text; for example, using characters or a setting from a familiar story

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Illustrate a simple text
Elaboration: Illustrating a simple text to add detail, for example to give additional information about an event, character or setting in a story

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Illustrate a simple text
Elaboration: Using drawings as a basis for spoken explanations or captioning using simple writing

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use a simple, familiar text structure repeatedly
Elaboration: Writing or dictating simple statements in time sequence, for example ‘I get my bag.’ and ‘I eat lunch.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use a simple, familiar text structure repeatedly
Elaboration: Writing recounts or stories using repetitive time or sequence connectives, for example ‘First I …, then I …’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use a simple, familiar text structure repeatedly
Elaboration: Using a teacher-modelled planner to write a simple narrative text with a beginning–middle–end structure

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use a simple, familiar text structure repeatedly
Elaboration: Planning for a variety of text features, for example by placing text appropriately on a page, leaving space for a drawing

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write simple, repetitive modelled sentences
Elaboration: Writing a small range of sentences copied from a model text, for example ‘I like …’, ‘I went to …’ and ‘Today is …’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write simple, repetitive modelled sentences
Elaboration: Writing simple strings of words that approximate their own spoken structures, for example ‘go to school’, ‘go home’ and ‘come from’, although they may demonstrate errors or inconsistency in grammar and word order

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write simple, repetitive modelled sentences
Elaboration: Writing repetitive sentence beginnings, for example ‘I … Then I … Then I …’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write simple, repetitive modelled sentences
Elaboration: Using the most common coordinating conjunctions (‘and’ and ‘but’) to connect clauses

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Demonstrate some control of basic verb forms
Elaboration: Using a variety of common action verbs (such as ‘sit’, ‘eat’ and ‘play’), sensing verbs (such as ‘want’ and ‘like’) and relating verbs (such as ‘be’ and ‘have’)

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Demonstrate some control of basic verb forms
Elaboration: Controlling simple past tense for common verbs, including some regular verbs (such as ‘played’ and ‘liked’) and some common irregular verbs (such as ‘went’, ‘was’ and ‘saw’)

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Demonstrate some control of basic verb forms
Elaboration: Expressing negatives in the most basic forms; for example, using ‘no’ and ‘not’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use some common noun–verb and adjective–noun combinations
Elaboration: Using simple noun–verb combinations to express personal opinions or responses, for example in ‘Dog runs fast.’ and ‘Ice cream is cold.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use some common noun–verb and adjective–noun combinations
Elaboration: Using simple adjectives to express personal opinions or responses, for example in ‘yummy cake’, ‘cold water’ and ‘blue sky’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write an increasing range of high-frequency words related to personal experiences and school context
Elaboration: Referring to classroom charts and a simple personal vocabulary list to check and confirm the spelling of high-frequency words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write an increasing range of high-frequency words related to personal experiences and school context
Elaboration: Recording high-frequency words in a simple personal vocabulary list

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write an increasing range of high-frequency words related to personal experiences and school context
Elaboration: Matching high-frequency words with correct objects in the classroom

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Accurately spell some consonant–vowel–consonant (CVC) words and common words learnt in class
Elaboration: Spelling some high-frequency words accurately from memory, for example their own name, short words used regularly and consonant–vowel–consonant (CVC) words such as ‘bag’, ‘top’ and ‘get’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Accurately spell some consonant–vowel–consonant (CVC) words and common words learnt in class
Elaboration: Unjumbling simple misspelled words to show correct spelling

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use common familiar punctuation
Elaboration: Writing upper-case and lower-case letters and full stops accurately when copying

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use common familiar punctuation
Elaboration: Beginning to copy more complex punctuation accurately, for example copying commas, question marks, exclamation marks and quotation marks

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to the terms ‘writing’ and ‘drawing’ appropriately, with teacher support
Elaboration: Responding appropriately to a request to write or draw about personal experience or classroom topics

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to the terms ‘writing’ and ‘drawing’ appropriately, with teacher support
Elaboration: Following simple instructions using writing terminology, for example when asked ‘Please write your name in capital letters.’ and ‘Leave a line in between.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to the terms ‘writing’ and ‘drawing’ appropriately, with teacher support
Elaboration: Distinguishing any conventions of a home language script (such as letters and symbols) from English conventions

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to the terms ‘writing’ and ‘drawing’ appropriately, with teacher support
Elaboration: Writing from left to right and leaving spaces between groups of letters or between words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to the terms ‘writing’ and ‘drawing’ appropriately, with teacher support
Elaboration: Forming both upper-case and lower-case letters consistently and legibly in different contexts, and using different writing implements

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to the terms ‘writing’ and ‘drawing’ appropriately, with teacher support
Elaboration: Planning layout, for example by placing headings at the top of a page or leaving room for a drawing

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to the terms ‘writing’ and ‘drawing’ appropriately, with teacher support
Elaboration: Creating drawings that add meaning to a written text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Actively engage in improving writing, with teacher support
Elaboration: Demonstrating awareness that spelling needs to be accurate and consistent; for example, copying words carefully, asking how to spell a word and asking for a word to be written so it can be copied

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Actively engage in improving writing, with teacher support
Elaboration: Correcting their own text when read aloud by the student or the teacher

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Actively engage in improving writing, with teacher support
Elaboration: Making corrections to their own writing when copying text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Actively engage in improving writing, with teacher support
Elaboration: Copying a corrected version of their own text, for example with corrected spelling or capital letters

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Actively engage in improving writing, with teacher support
Elaboration: Recording high-frequency words in a simple personal vocabulary list

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Actively engage in improving writing, with teacher support
Elaboration: Referring to classroom charts and a simple personal vocabulary list to check and confirm the spelling of high-frequency words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on a range of home language resources to enhance learning when writing
Elaboration: Asking home language peers to explain an idea in a home language and asking for a translation in English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on a range of home language resources to enhance learning when writing
Elaboration: Writing in home language script or transliterating the sound of a home language word in English letters when the English word is unfamiliar

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on a range of home language resources to enhance learning when writing
Elaboration: Asking home language peers or the teacher for the English translation and spelling of a home language word

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Contribute ideas, words or sentences to a class or group shared story, with teacher support
Elaboration: Listening to the contributions of others and adding new or different ideas

ContentDescription: Contribute ideas, words or sentences to a class or group shared story, with teacher support
Elaboration: Making suggestions for ideas to include in a text, for example about the people and events

ContentDescription: Contribute ideas, words or sentences to a class or group shared story, with teacher support
Elaboration: Drawing on familiar vocabulary and sentence structures to suggest expressions for shared writing

ContentDescription: Contribute ideas, words or sentences to a class or group shared story, with teacher support
Elaboration: Completing cloze activities based on a shared text experience

ContentDescription: Contribute ideas, words or sentences to a class or group shared story, with teacher support
Elaboration: Choosing a sentence from a shared text to use as a caption for an image
